Line 3: Line 3:
==Teachers and staff==
==Teachers and staff==
===Argus Filch===
===Argus Filch===
â
[[Image:ArgusFilch.gif|thumb|250px|[[David Bradley]] as Argus Filch in ''[[Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets]]'']]
 
'''Argus Filch''' is the caretaker of Hogwarts. While he is not a wholly evil character, he is certainly both short- and ill-tempered, which has made him very unpopular with the student body, and occasionally with some teachers. His knowledge of the secrets and short-cuts of the castle is almost unparalleled, except perhaps by the [[Weasley twins]] and users of the [[Marauder's Map]]. He has been known to favour almost sadistically harsh punishments, leading to his alliance with [[Dolores Umbridge]], and to have an obsessive dislike of mud, animate toys, and all other things that might interfere with his creation of an immaculately clean and orderly Hogwarts.
'''Argus Filch''' is the caretaker of Hogwarts. While he is not a wholly evil character, he is certainly both short- and ill-tempered, which has made him very unpopular with the student body, and occasionally with some teachers. His knowledge of the secrets and short-cuts of the castle is almost unparalleled, except perhaps by the [[Weasley twins]] and users of the [[Marauder's Map]]. He has been known to favour almost sadistically harsh punishments, leading to his alliance with [[Dolores Umbridge]], and to have an obsessive dislike of mud, animate toys, and all other things that might interfere with his creation of an immaculately clean and orderly Hogwarts.
Line 15: Line 14:
===Filius Flitwick===
===Filius Flitwick===
â
[[Image:FiliusFlitwick.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Warwick Davis]] as Filius Flitwick in ''[[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix]]'']]
 
'''Filius Flitwick''' is the [[Hogwarts#Charms|Charms]] Master at Hogwarts and the head of [[Ravenclaw]], and is described as being very short. In ''Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone'' he uses his magical skills to help decorate the Great Hall at Christmas time. He is also one of the teachers that cast spells to guard the [[Magical objects in Harry Potter#Philosopher's Stone|Philosopher's Stone]] by putting charms on a hundred keys so they can fly, making it difficult to find the key to the door of the next chamber.
'''Filius Flitwick''' is the [[Hogwarts#Charms|Charms]] Master at Hogwarts and the head of [[Ravenclaw]], and is described as being very short. In ''Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone'' he uses his magical skills to help decorate the Great Hall at Christmas time. He is also one of the teachers that cast spells to guard the [[Magical objects in Harry Potter#Philosopher's Stone|Philosopher's Stone]] by putting charms on a hundred keys so they can fly, making it difficult to find the key to the door of the next chamber.
Line 28: Line 26:
===Rolanda Hooch===
===Rolanda Hooch===
â
[[Image:RolandaHooch.png|thumb|250px|[[ZoÃ« Wanamaker]] as Rolanda Hooch in ''[[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (film)|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone]]'']]
 
'''Rolanda Hooch''' is the flying instructor and [[Quidditch]] referee at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Rolanda is near one hundred years of age during Harry Potter's education at Hogwarts. Despite this, Hooch is always seen as quite an energetic witch.
'''Rolanda Hooch''' is the flying instructor and [[Quidditch]] referee at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Rolanda is near one hundred years of age during Harry Potter's education at Hogwarts. Despite this, Hooch is always seen as quite an energetic witch.
Line 38: Line 35:
===Gilderoy Lockhart===
===Gilderoy Lockhart===
â
[[Image:GilderoyLockhart.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Kenneth Branagh]] as Gilderoy Lockhart in ''[[Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets]]'']]
 
'''Gilderoy Lockhart''' is a narcissistic wizarding celebrity who has written many books on his fabulous adventures encountering dark creatures. In ''Chamber of Secrets'', Lockhart is appointed as Hogwarts' new [[Hogwarts#Defence Against the Dark Arts|Defence Against the Dark Arts]] instructor. He is unpopular amongst most of the staff, particularly Professor Snape; however, he is greatly admired by many others, particularly witches, such as [[Hermione Granger]] and [[Molly Weasley|Mrs Weasley]], who fancy him. Harry dislikes him for a number of reasons: his smarminess, his belief that Harry flew to Hogwarts in a [[Magical objects in Harry Potter#Mr Weasley's car|car]] to seek further attention, his penchant for handing out signed photos of himself, and the trouble he has with simple magic such as healing Harry's broken arm—he accidentally removes all of Harry's arm bones instead. Lockhart is exposed as a fraud and a coward when he attempts to avoid entering the [[Chamber of Secrets]] by revealing to Harry and [[Ron Weasley]] that he never performed the amazing feats documented in his books, instead stealing other wizards' experiences and [[Spells in Harry Potter#Obliviate (Memory Charm)|erasing their memories]]. His attempt to use a Memory Charm on Harry and Ron backfires due to his use of Ron's broken wand, and he suffers the permanent near-total loss of his own memory as a result.
'''Gilderoy Lockhart''' is a narcissistic wizarding celebrity who has written many books on his fabulous adventures encountering dark creatures. In ''Chamber of Secrets'', Lockhart is appointed as Hogwarts' new [[Hogwarts#Defence Against the Dark Arts|Defence Against the Dark Arts]] instructor. He is unpopular amongst most of the staff, particularly Professor Snape; however, he is greatly admired by many others, particularly witches, such as [[Hermione Granger]] and [[Molly Weasley|Mrs Weasley]], who fancy him. Harry dislikes him for a number of reasons: his smarminess, his belief that Harry flew to Hogwarts in a [[Magical objects in Harry Potter#Mr Weasley's car|car]] to seek further attention, his penchant for handing out signed photos of himself, and the trouble he has with simple magic such as healing Harry's broken arm—he accidentally removes all of Harry's arm bones instead. Lockhart is exposed as a fraud and a coward when he attempts to avoid entering the [[Chamber of Secrets]] by revealing to Harry and [[Ron Weasley]] that he never performed the amazing feats documented in his books, instead stealing other wizards' experiences and [[Spells in Harry Potter#Obliviate (Memory Charm)|erasing their memories]]. His attempt to use a Memory Charm on Harry and Ron backfires due to his use of Ron's broken wand, and he suffers the permanent near-total loss of his own memory as a result.
Line 48: Line 44:
===Minerva McGonagall===
===Minerva McGonagall===
â
[[Image:MinervaMcGonagall.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Maggie Smith]] as Minerva McGonagall in ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]'']]
 
'''Minerva McGonagall''' is [[Head teacher|Deputy Headmistress]], head of [[Gryffindor]] House, [[Hogwarts#Transfiguration|Transfiguration]] professor, and later Headmistress at Hogwarts, where she began teaching in December 1956. She is first introduced in the opening chapter of ''[[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone]]'', when she meets Dumbledore at [[Number 4 Privet Drive]], [[Little Whinging]], [[Surrey]] (the home of Harry Potter's aunt and uncle). McGonagall is described as a tall, rather severe-looking woman, with black hair typically drawn into a tight bun. She wears emerald green robes, a pointed hat, and always has a very prim expression. She is, according to Rowling, a sprightly 70-year-old.<ref>[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2000/1000-scholastic-chat.htm Scholastic Chat]. accio-quote.org.</ref> McGonagall wears square spectacles that match the markings around the eyes of her [[Animagus]] form of a silver [[tabby cat]]; she has the distinction of being the first Animagus introduced in the series and being one of the few registered Animagi of the century. Harry's immediate impression of her is of someone who is not to be crossed. She has a fondness for tartan, and her handkerchief, dressing gown and dress robes are patterned with it. Rowling has said McGonagall's birthday is 4 October.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-leaky-cauldron.org/2007/10/3/happy-birthday-minerva-mcgonagall|title=Happy Birthday, Minerva McGonagall!|date=3 October 2007|accessdate=4 October 2007|publisher=[[The Leaky Cauldron (web site)|The Leaky Cauldron]]}}</ref>
'''Minerva McGonagall''' is [[Head teacher|Deputy Headmistress]], head of [[Gryffindor]] House, [[Hogwarts#Transfiguration|Transfiguration]] professor, and later Headmistress at Hogwarts, where she began teaching in December 1956. She is first introduced in the opening chapter of ''[[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone]]'', when she meets Dumbledore at [[Number 4 Privet Drive]], [[Little Whinging]], [[Surrey]] (the home of Harry Potter's aunt and uncle). McGonagall is described as a tall, rather severe-looking woman, with black hair typically drawn into a tight bun. She wears emerald green robes, a pointed hat, and always has a very prim expression. She is, according to Rowling, a sprightly 70-year-old.<ref>[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2000/1000-scholastic-chat.htm Scholastic Chat]. accio-quote.org.</ref> McGonagall wears square spectacles that match the markings around the eyes of her [[Animagus]] form of a silver [[tabby cat]]; she has the distinction of being the first Animagus introduced in the series and being one of the few registered Animagi of the century. Harry's immediate impression of her is of someone who is not to be crossed. She has a fondness for tartan, and her handkerchief, dressing gown and dress robes are patterned with it. Rowling has said McGonagall's birthday is 4 October.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-leaky-cauldron.org/2007/10/3/happy-birthday-minerva-mcgonagall|title=Happy Birthday, Minerva McGonagall!|date=3 October 2007|accessdate=4 October 2007|publisher=[[The Leaky Cauldron (web site)|The Leaky Cauldron]]}}</ref>
Line 162: Line 157:
===Nearly Headless Nick===
===Nearly Headless Nick===
â
[[Image:Nearly headless nick hpps.jpg|thumb|150px|[[John Cleese]] as Nearly Headless Nick in ''[[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (film)|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone]]'']]
 
'''Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington''', often referred to as '''Nearly Headless Nick''' or '''Nick''', is the Gryffindor House ghost who in life was sentenced to death by beheading after a teeth-straightening spell went awry on Lady Grieve.<ref>[http://www.jkrowling.com/en/ J.K.Rowling Official Site - Harry Potter and more<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Unfortunately the executioner's axe was blunt and after 45 hacks Nick's head was still only partially severed. Harry becomes friends with Nick when he attends his "deathday" party (the 500th anniversary of the event) in a Hogwarts dungeon. Nick's death date (31 October 1492) has the distinction of having served as the basis for the entire chronology of the ''Harry Potter'' stories, until the timeline was confirmed by the headstone of [[Marauders (Harry Potter)#James Potter|James]] and [[Lily Potter]] in ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows]]''. His greatest wish is to become a member of the Headless Hunt, as mentioned in the second book. However, he is excluded due to the fact that he is not actually headless and would not be able to fully participate in the activities.
'''Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington''', often referred to as '''Nearly Headless Nick''' or '''Nick''', is the Gryffindor House ghost who in life was sentenced to death by beheading after a teeth-straightening spell went awry on Lady Grieve.<ref>[http://www.jkrowling.com/en/ J.K.Rowling Official Site - Harry Potter and more<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Unfortunately the executioner's axe was blunt and after 45 hacks Nick's head was still only partially severed. Harry becomes friends with Nick when he attends his "deathday" party (the 500th anniversary of the event) in a Hogwarts dungeon. Nick's death date (31 October 1492) has the distinction of having served as the basis for the entire chronology of the ''Harry Potter'' stories, until the timeline was confirmed by the headstone of [[Marauders (Harry Potter)#James Potter|James]] and [[Lily Potter]] in ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows]]''. His greatest wish is to become a member of the Headless Hunt, as mentioned in the second book. However, he is excluded due to the fact that he is not actually headless and would not be able to fully participate in the activities.
